intro: Pimpinella major var. laciniata, commonly known as the cut-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens due to its delicate foliage and early spring blooms.
